intro: Clinhymenia pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, helping it conserve moisture in dry environments. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Clinhymenia pallidiflora is often found in coastal dunes and dry grasslands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
